definition.featurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><block type="feature_container" deletable="false" x="169" y="69"><value name="feature"><block type="feature_simple_random_selector"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="3"></mutation><value name="feature0"><block type="feature_ore"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" inputs="1"></mutation><field name="size">14</field><field name="discardOnAirChance">0</field><comment pinned="false" h="118" w="231">This block represents a feature for quartz ore. Nether ores should be generated during the UNDERGROUND_DECORATION generation stage.</comment><value name="target0"><block type="ore_target"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">If the target block is netherrack, replace it with quartz ore</comment><value name="target"><block type="rule_test_block_match"><field name="block">CUSTOM:SwampStone</field></block></value><value name="state"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">Blocks.SCULK</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><value name="feature1"><block type="feature_huge_fungus"><field name="planted">FALSE</field><comment pinned="false" h="99" w="243">This block represent a crimson fungus, like the ones found in the Crimson Forest biome.This feature should be added during the VEGETAL_DECORATION stage</comment><value name="stem"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:FakeLog</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the stem of the fungus</comment></block></value><value name="hat"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:FakeLeaves</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the hat (or "leaves") of the fungus</comment></block></value><value name="decor"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:AncientSculk</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the decorative block that can appear inside the fungus cap</comment></block></value><value name="ground"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:Crenrit</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the valid ground for the fungus. It cannot generate on other blocks</comment></block></value><value name="replaceable_blocks"><block type="block_predicate_matching_blocks"><field name="x">0</field><field name="y">0</field><field name="z">0</field><comment pinned="false" h="93" w="243">The fungus stem can replace any block that matches this condition. Here we check if the block to be replaced is in the "replaceable_by_trees" tag. This parameter is only used for versions 1.20 and above</comment><value name="blockSet"><block type="block_holderset_tag"><field name="tag">replaceable_by_trees</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><value name="feature2"><block type="feature_replace_sphere" inline="false"><comment pinned="false" h="114" w="249">This block represents a blob feature that replaces netherrack with blackstone, like the ones that generate in the Nether.This feature should be generated during the UNDERGROUND_DECORATION stage</comment><value name="targetState"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:SwampStone</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the block being replaced (in this case netherrack)</comment></block></value><value name="newState"><block type="mcitem_allblocks"><field name="value">CUSTOM:SwampSoil</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the block that will be placed by the feature (in this case blackstone)</comment></block></value><value name="radius"><block type="int_provider_uniform"><field name="min">3</field><field name="max">7</field><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">This is the size of the blob</comment></block></value></block></value></block></value><next><block type="placement_count_on_every_layer"><comment pinned="false" h="101" w="207">This placement type works best for Nether biomes. We generate the huge fungus 8 times on each vertical layer, so that we have a proper forest at any height</comment><value name="count"><block type="int_provider_constant"><field name="value">16</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_biome_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We add a biome filter, so that the fungi don't generate outside of the current biome</comment></block></next></block></next></block><block type="placement_count" x="169" y="727"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We try to generate up to 25 blackstone blobs in each chunk</comment><value name="count"><block type="int_provider_constant"><field name="value">25</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_in_square"><comment pinned="false" h="83" w="182">We then move each blob horizontally. This way they don't generate only in the corner of the chunk</comment><next><block type="placement_height_uniform"><comment pinned="false" h="78" w="191">The blobs have uniform distribution, so they can generate at any height with the same probability.</comment><value name="min"><block type="vertical_anchor_above_bottom"><field name="value">0</field></block></value><value name="max"><block type="vertical_anchor_below_top"><field name="value">0</field></block></value><next><block type="placement_biome_filter"><comment pinned="false" h="80" w="160">We add a biome filter, so that the blobs don't generate outside of the current biome</comment></block></next></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
